metadata.title: CVE-2023-34328 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: [This CNA information record relates to multiple CVEs; the text explainswhich aspects/vulnerabilities correspond to which CVE.] AMD CPUs since~2014 have extensions to normal x86 debugging functionality. Xen supportsguests using these extensions. Unfortunately there are errors in Xen'shandling of the guest state, leading to denials of service. 1)CVE-2023-34327 - An HVM vCPU can end up operating in the context of aprevious vCPUs debug mask state. 2) CVE-2023-34328 - A PV vCPU can place abreakpoint over the live GDT. This allows the PV vCPU to exploit XSA-156 /CVE-2015-8104 and lock up the CPU entirely.

criterions.comment: xen package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
